alert.note: Alert for Lassen-Eastern Plumas-Eastern Sierra Counties (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued March 14 at 9:41AM PDT until March 15 at 5:00AM PDT by NWS Reno
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM PDT WEDNESDAY... * CHANGES...Adjusted expiration time to early Wednesday morning. * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Additional snow accumulations up to 2 inches for lower elevation areas including around Susanville. 3 to 6 inches west of US-395 below 6000 feet, with 8 to 14 inches above 6000 feet. * WHERE...Lassen-Eastern Plumas-Eastern Sierra Counties. * WHEN...Until 5 AM PDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible with snowfall rates 1 to 2 inches per hour at times through this evening. Heavy snow accumulations could cause tree damage and lead to power outages. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow levels near 7000 feet will fall during the afternoon and evening, down below 5000 feet by late tonight.
info.instruction: Avoid travel if possible, you could be stuck in your vehicle for many hours. If you must travel, prepare for long delays and carry an emergency kit with extra food, water and clothing. If you stay home, have a backup plan in case of power outages. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
